description: Consider problem of placing N queens on an n X n board so that each queen attacks precisely k others. Here k=1 and sequence gives number of inequivalent solutions when N is equal to the upper bound 2*floor(2n/3).
comments: a(n) = 0 if N does not achieve 2*floor(2n/3).
references: M. Gardner, The Last Recreations, Springer, 1997, p. 282.
M. Gardner, The Colossal Book of Mathematics, 2001, p. 209.
links: Vaclav Kotesovec, The unique solution for chessboard 9x9
crossrefs: The number of solutions when N takes its maximal value is A051757.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: Description corrected by and one more term from _Jud McCranie_, Aug 25 2001
